text: Dioscorea ovinala is a species of yam in the family Dioscoreaceae. It is endemic to Madagascar and grows mostly in dry deciduous forests. ==Uses== Dioscorea ovinala is important to the Malagasy people as food and medicine. This species is also used as a starch source. ==References== ovinala Category:Taxa named by John Gilbert Baker
title: Dioscorea ovinala
